medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 3 days prior to admission with the development of fevers. The patient awoke 2 days prior to admission with left lower quadrant abdominal pain at 3 a.m., accompanied by nausea throughout the day. Symptoms persisted without change after seeing her PCP, and chills developed thereafter. The patient denied vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, melena, or hematochezia and reported normal bowel movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension; prior colonoscopy for hematochezia with removal of polyps, and one episode of hematochezia with intense abdominal cramping about one month prior.
